bibl.title: Letter from Juan D. Castro to Philip Showalter Hench, September 10, 1940

div1.p: Castro describes a 1904 history of Las Animas Hospital, by Barnet and Guiteras.

div1.head: Letter from Juan D. Castro to Philip Showalter Hench, September 10, 1940
div1.opener:
República de Cuba
----
Secretaría de Sanidad y Beneficencia
----
Habana Cuba, Sept. 10th 1940.
Al contestar consígnese fecha y nú-
mero de esta comunicación.
En cada escrito trátese de un solo
asunto.
Dear Dr Hench,
div1.p:
Just recieved yours dated Aug. 28th, and hasten
to reply, so as to be as helpfull as possible,

Consulted several people, and called three different
libraries, and only found out that in the year 1904, a bulletin
was written by Dr Barnet, with appendix by Dr. Guiteras, only
on history of the Las Animas Hospital. Looking over same I found
several very important pictures, such as,
1. Birds eye view of the Hospital.
2. Topographic map.
3. Screened entrance leading to Pavillion No 1.
4. Front view of Ward 1
5. Transportation of patient from abroad.
6. Patients arrival at Hospital.
7. Convalescents dinning room.
8. Directors Quarters.
9. Blue print-New ward for Yellow F, patients.
10. Cage for yellow F and Malaria patients.
11. Cage for manipulating infested mosquitoes.
There are a few other pictures, but of secondary importance. The
theme of the bulletin is contained in about 25 pages, I tried
my best to get a copy to send you, but found it is impossible,
That bulletin was issued by the Secretaria de Governacion, part
of which was at thet time the Health Dept. and beign so far back
there are no copies obtainable. And of course the library wont
loan out the copy it has.

I asked about taking copies of the pictures and of the
theme, and was told it would be O.K.

Consulted a photographer and said he will take copies
of the pictures for 1.25 each. and a translator will make the
theme in english for $10.00. The whole thing would be worth about
$30.00. But it certainly is worth it for your work. In case you
desire the work done I'll help you all I can.

The hospital has not been changed in the last 40 years, only two
old buildings were torn down, and of course the others have been
repaired several times and painted.

Tne Hospital Militar No 1. is the one called today Gral Calixto
Garcia, but all the buildings are new.

It will be an honor for me to recieve the weekly procedings of
the Mayo Clinic.
Desiring to help you all I can,
div1.closer:
Yours truly. Dr. Juan D Castro.
Instituto Finlay,
Infanta y Zaldo.
Habana,
